intro: Viola maillardii, commonly known as Maillard's violet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America, specifically in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces delicate, violet-colored flowers with yellow markings. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
